words.definition: To suffer from a sickness or problem.
words.example: He was afflicted with a rare disease.

words.definition: A passage between rows of seats.
words.example: She walked down the aisle to find her seat.

words.definition: The air around the Earth.
words.example: The Earthâ€™s atmosphere protects us.

words.definition: A person who writes books.
words.example: She is the author of many novels.

words.definition: A failure of a machine or system.
words.example: The car had a breakdown on the highway.

words.definition: The goods carried by a ship or plane.
words.example: The ship was carrying a large cargo of oil.

words.definition: A part of a book.
words.example: I read the first chapter of the book.

words.definition: To join things together.
words.example: I connected the two wires together.

words.definition: Short way of saying 'and so on'.
words.example: I need to buy milk, bread, etc.

words.definition: To turn something over quickly.
words.example: He flipped the coin.

words.definition: When someone is not doing anything.
words.example: He spent the afternoon being idle.

words.definition: To tell someone about something.
words.example: I will notify you when it arrives.

words.definition: A small, round, green vegetable.
words.example: I like to eat peas with my dinner.

words.definition: A dried grape.
words.example: I like to put raisins in my oatmeal.

words.definition: To keep something.
words.example: She retained her title as the champion.

words.definition: To say it in a formal way.
words.example: He stated his opinion on the matter.

words.definition: A flat piece for carrying things.
words.example: The waiter carried the drinks on a tray.

words.definition: When something is unlucky.
words.example: It was an unfortunate accident.

words.definition: When something is very bright or clear.
words.example: She had a vivid dream last night.

words.definition: To bring up food from your stomach.
words.example: The bad food made him vomit.
